image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Record number of UK Cabinet ministers defeated in general election
How Keir Starmer defied expectations to lift Labour back to power
item.description: Starmer has now led Labour to victory, potentially securing the largest majority in Parliament since Tony Blair’s New Labour landslide in 1997. The presumptive prime minister has significantly exceeded expectations since succeeding the hard-left leader Jeremy Corbyn in 2020. Despite being seen as bland and boring, and not a "Tony Blair," Starmer has partially benefited from favorable circumstances, helping him revive Labour's prospects.

item.title: Iran votes in runoff election to replace President Raisi who died in crash
item.description: Iran gears up for a presidential election runoff between Pezeshkian and Jalili following a record-low turnout in the first round. Both candidates have differing views on international relations and economic challenges. The election outcome could have significant implications for Iran's future direction.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Russia accuses US fighter jet of coming dangerously close to Russian plane
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: UK parliamentary elections: Why Rishi Sunak's Conservative Party suffered a historic defeat
item.description: Keir Starmer will be Britain's next prime minister with his centre left Labour Party expected to win a huge majority in a parliamentary election, ending 14 years of often tumultuous Conservative government by trouncing Rishi Sunak's party. "Tonight, people here and around the country have spoken and they're ready for change, to end the politics of performance, a return to politics as public service," Starmer said after winning his seat in London. "The change begins right here ... You have voted. It is now time for us to deliver."
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'I am sorry': Rishi Sunak concedes defeat in UK general election, congratulates Keir Starmer for landslide victory
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Police officer shoots man who killed 8-year-old brother in New York
item.description: In Queens, New York, a police officer fatally shot a man who had allegedly stabbed his 8-year-old brother and parents. Responding to a distress call, officers found the suspect holding his father hostage with a knife. Despite commands to drop the weapon, he did not comply, prompting the officer to fire, saving the father's life. Both brothers succumbed to their injuries, while their parents received medical care.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Nigel Farage’s Reform UK secures first-ever Parliamentary seat, marks major shift in British politics
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Putin: Trump ‘sincerely’ wants to end War in Ukraine
item.description: President Vladimir Putin expressed that Russia takes Donald Trump's statements about having proposals to end the war in Ukraine quickly seriously. Putin admitted he is not familiar with the specifics of Trump's proposals but believes Trump's intentions are sincere and that Russia would support them. Putin made these remarks during a news conference in Astana, Kazakhstan, after attending a summit of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization.

item.title: Brazil's Bolsonaro formally accused over Saudi gifts, sources say
item.description: Brazilian police accused ex-President Bolsonaro of embezzling Saudi luxury jewelry. Justice Alexandre de Moraes led the investigation. Seized items for the first lady were found in October 2021 at Sao Paulo airport. Bolsonaro, also facing forgery charges, had sales probed. Customs officials and military officers were involved, with Lula da Silva's administration pressing for the inquiry.

item.title: Meghan Markle eyes endorsement for new brand from King Charles: Report
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Israel-Hamas hostage talks have 'breakthrough', says US official
item.description: Hamas and Israel are nearing a potential hostage release deal, according to a US official. However, he did caution that a final deal is not expected to be reached within days. Netanyahu convened a security meeting and will be sending delegates, which will reportedly including David Barnea, to Doha for Qatari-Egyptian mediated talks. The White House affirmed Biden's backing, marking a step towards a ceasefire.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: UK left-wing maverick Galloway loses his parliamentary seat
item.description: George Galloway lost his Rochdale seat to Labour’s Paul Waugh. His pro-Palestinian stance had garnered Muslim support. Expelled from Labour in 2003 for criticizing Tony Blair over Iraq, Galloway met Saddam Hussein and impersonated a cat on reality TV. His critique of Labour's Gaza policy angered Britain’s 3.9 million Muslims.

item.title: Social Media platforms to be banned for 6 days in Pakistan
item.description: From July 13-18, Pakistan will ban YouTube, WhatsApp, Facebook, Instagram, and TikTok to curb "hate material" and sectarian violence. Backed by PM Shehbaz Sharif, Maryam Nawaz, Gen Asim Munir, and Ishaq Dar, this follows X’s ban and alleged election tampering. The Punjab government aims to prevent unrest, previously arresting activists criticizing Imran Khan’s ouster.
item.dc:creator: TOI News Desk

item.title: From fiscal rules to economic stability: Top challenges for UK's new leadership
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Meghan Markle wraps filming Netflix cooking show: Another royal reveal?
item.description: ​When Harry and Meghan signed the deal with Netflix, they released a statement saying: "Our lives, both independent of each other and as a couple, have allowed us to understand the power of the human spirit: of courage, resilience, and the need for connection." ​Meghan has already unveiled her new business venture America Riviera Orchard -- a lifestyle brand under which she intends to sell an array of products -- jam, skincare, make-up, gardening supplies, dog food, scented candles.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Biden choked like dog, Kamala Harris 'highly talented': Donald Trump's 4th July message
item.description: The social media post came hours after Trump called Biden a "broken down pile of crap" in a leaked video. Sitting in a golf cart -- with his son Barron Trump on his side -- Trump was seen holding a wad of cash asking a group of individuals how he performed in the debate.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Indian economist N K Singh is conferred honorary fellowship by LSE
item.dc:creator: Naomi Canton

item.title: When did Biden have last medical check-up? There are theories
item.description: Biden leads a healthy lifestyle -- he is a teetotal, exercises regularly and doesn't smoke. According to his physician, Biden exercises five times a week. He also plays golf. As far as the diet is concerned, Biden prefers carbs over greens, has a sweet tooth, enjoys peanut butter and jam sandwiches, biscuits, ice cream sundaes. Other favorites include bacon, lettuce and tomato sandwiches and pizza. His choice of drink is orange Gatorade.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Switzerland tries to flatten out peaks of Alpine visitors
item.description: Switzerland’s tourism agency aims to balance tourist flow by promoting off-seasons and lesser-known destinations. Chief Martin Nydegger and Damian Constantin note localized surges and the impact of a strong franc and high costs limiting mass tourism. Generating 43 billion francs (4.5 percent of GDP), autumn tourism and Davos-Klosters luxury tours are promoted using Chinese influencers and survey-backed positive opinions.
